questions.question: Which ancient ruin in Greece is celebrated for its role as the most important sanctuary of Apollo, where the famous oracle provided guidance and was rebuilt after a destructive fire in 548 BC?
questions.context: Known for the Pythian Games, this site houses the Temple of Apollo, which was central to Hellenic culture and religion.

questions.question: Which capital city in Europe is known for its rich history and serves as the seat of one of the oldest continuous democracies dating back to the 9th century?
questions.context: This city is the northernmost capital of a sovereign state, known for its scenic beauty and vibrant arts scene.

questions.question: Which UNESCO World Heritage Site in Africa houses over 2000 years of archaeological history, including the impressive rock-hewn churches built in the 12th century?
questions.context: Renowned for its monolithic rock-cut churches, this site is sometimes referred to as the 'New Jerusalem' and remains an active pilgrimage destination.

questions.question: Which modern architectural marvel in Asia, completed in 2010, is currently the tallest structure in the world?
questions.context: Standing at an astonishing height of 828 meters, this skyscraper is an engineering marvel and a symbol of modern urban development.

questions.question: In which famous museum in North America can you explore extensive exhibits dedicated to both the Natural and Art history, with its iconic paleontology wing hosting larger-than-life dinosaur fossils?

answer.label: American Museum of Natural History, New York City, USA

questions.context: Located across from Central Park, this museum is well-known for its contributions to research and its striking diorama halls.
